## Read in Data

```{r}
observations = read.csv("observations/tiger_observation_entry 9 SS observations.csv")
survey = read.csv("observations/tiger_observation_entry 9 SS surveys.csv")

head(observations)
unique(observations$survey.id)
head(survey)

library(tidyverse)

a = observations %>% filter(grid.cell.label == 'S26E05')
unique(observations$grid.cell.label)
names(observations)
#split(observations,grid.cell.label) %>% 
  
  
expand_dat <- observations %>% expand(nesting(name, trt), rep)
all
```

Replicates - refers to areas of high forest cover that are surveyed WITHIN a grid cell.  A grid cell is ~289km in area (see codebook for exact number). A grid cell can contain many replicates, where surveys were conducted to look for a tiger.
